item.title: Defenit: Baby Steganography
item.description: They give you a file without an extension, and hint that the “sub bit” contains some hidden data. problem file When I opened the file in hex fiend, I could see the header of RIFF‡ı∏WAVEfmt, indicating that it was a wav file. So I looked for a wav library, pulled out the samples, and tried to figure out where it might be hiding. There were two channels, left and right, and 16 bits for channels.
